data.title: Deadmau5 Wiki
data.text:
Hau5trap Founder Joel Zimmerman Founded 2021 Origin Toronto, Ontario, Canada Genre(s) Tech House, Bass House, Progressive House Website hau5trap.com

Hau5trap is a Canadian independent record label founded by deadmau5 in 2021. It operates as a subsidiary of the renowned record label mau5trap, with an extensive emphasis on house music.

History[edit | edit source]

In 2021, Zimmerman and his manager Dean Wilson announced the launch of a new sublabel, fourteen years after the foundation of mau5trap. On March 4, 2021, hau5trap was officially launched, debuting with Tommy Trash's "hiiigh" as its inaugural release. Regarding the creation of the sublabel, Zimmerman stated "with hau5trap, we get to support more things we love specifically in house music. Tommy Trash remixed my ‘Bridged By A Lightwave’ and ‘The Veldt’ tracks, so I’m happy to have him be the first artist to release on hau5trap.”[1]

The first deadmau5 track released on hau5trap was the single "Nextra" which came out on March 29th, 2021. To date, this stands as the sole deadmau5 track released under the label.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

The visual branding of hau5trap was designed by Rising Agency.[2]

Hau5trap is currently the sole subsidiary of mau5trap.
